thread.title: Australia's unlisted funds have best return in five years
thread.title_full: Australia's unlisted funds have best return in five years | afr.com

author: Mercedes Ruehl
title: Australia's unlisted funds have best return in five years
text:
In the three months to June Australian funds returned 3.3 per cent, the highest since 2010 by Mercedes Ruehl Australia's unlisted real estate funds have recorded their best performance in nearly five years.
In the three months to June Australian funds returned 3.3 per cent – the highest since 2010 – and 11.8 per cent on a one-year rolling return according to non-profit organisation Asian Association for Investors in Non-listed Real Estate Vehicles (ANREV).
The index, which began the quarterly index in Q1 2010, includes 96 funds and shows an increasing allocation to Australia. ANREV's quarterly index covered assets with a total gross asset value of US$92.5 billion ($131 billion) which is the highest total GAV since it was first released.
For the Asia Pacific region overall, non-listed real estate funds generated returns of 2.6 per cent in the second quarter of 2015, compared to 2.5 per cent in the previous quarter.
"Non-listed funds in Asia Pacific showed a steady performance for the second quarter of 2015 and passed the hurdle of a 10 per cent total return on a one year rolling basis, the first time in four years," Amelie Delaunay, the Director of Research & Professional Standards for ANREV, said.
